As your partner, I cannot agree with you that the behavior you described would not be controlling. Criticizing someone in a humorous way can still be harmful and controling, as it implies that the person being criticized is not good enough or is doing something wrong. It also implies that the speaker has the right to judge and correct the other person. It's important to remember that humor should never be used to belittle or control someone else, but rather to bring joy and connection between people. If you find yourself using humor to criticize or put down your partner, it may be worth examining why you are doing so and how you can work on building a more respectful and equal relationship.
